## Biography
Nicholas Kissel is a third year statistics PhD student at CMU. He received an MS in statistics and BS in math & statistics from Pitt in 2019. He is am primarily interested in developing methods for generating model confidence sets. More broadly, he is interested in creating inferential procedures for machine learning modeling methods, as well as developing accessible statistical tools that are applicable to natural and social science research.
